Title: Recruitment of academics in Switzerland: E pluribus unum?
Source: Form., Recruiting and Managing the Academic Profession
Abstract: © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2015.This paper explores the transformation of academic recruitment in Switzerland by focusing on structures and processes observed through their actor configuration. As the so-called collegial department model is increasingly overlapping with the traditional chair system, variations in practices are detectable according to disciplines and types of institutions. Based on qualitative data gathered in the framework of the ESF EuroAC project, this research shows, on the one side, how traditionally differentiated academic recruitment practices tend to converge through standardization and, on the other side, how differences between universities, institutes of technology and universities of applied sciences as well as differences among disciplines — e.g. hard-soft — impact on pace and depth of such change.
